title: A Guide to Bumble's SuperSwipe (& How to See Who SuperSwiped You)

steps.title: Bumble will send you a notification when someone SuperSwipes you.
steps.content: Bumble will send you a notification when someone SuperSwipes you. You can tap the notification to head over to your match queue or simply launch the Bumble app (or Bumble on the web) at any time. [1] X Research source And don't worry—even if you miss the notification, SuperSwipes never expire—you can still find out who SuperSwiped you if you miss the notification!

steps.title: Swipe through your matches to see SuperSwipes.
steps.content: Swipe through your matches to see SuperSwipes. According to Bumble users on Reddit who've tested the SuperSwipe feature, the person who SuperSwiped you probably won't be the first person in your match queue , but they'll be near the top of the stack. When you reach the person who SuperSwiped you, you'll see a yellow icon with two stars and "SuperSwiped You!" on their profile. You'll still see SuperSwipes even if you swiped left on a person. If a person you swiped left on SuperSwipes you, Bumble will give you a second chance to check out their profile and see if it's worthy of a right swipe!

steps.title: Check your Beeline if you have Bumble Premium.
steps.content: Check your Beeline if you have Bumble Premium. With Bumble Premium, you have the advantage of the Beeline, which tells you who already liked you before you swipe on them. [2] X Research source If someone in your Beeline SuperSwiped you, you'll see a yellow heart on their profile photo.

steps.title: SuperSwipe is a feature designed to show matches you really like them.
steps.content: SuperSwipe is a feature designed to show matches you really like them. Because it’s a premium feature, SuperSwipes must be purchased individually or used with a paid subscription. However, that makes a SuperSwipe compelling: it shows you’re so confident and interested in someone that you’ve made an effort to get your “like” to stand out from the others. To use a SuperSwipe: [3] X Research source Open up your Swipe queue on Bumble. When you find someone you want to SuperSwipe, tap the star icon on their profile. Once you activate the SuperSwipe, the potential match will get a notification about it (and can then respond, if they want to).

steps.title: SuperSwipes must be purchased in bundles on Bumble.
steps.content: SuperSwipes must be purchased in bundles on Bumble. You can buy 2 SuperSwipes for $10 (at $5 each), 5 SuperSwipes for $20 (at $4 each), 15 SuperSwipes for $40 (at $2.67 each) or 30 SuperSwipes for $60 (at $2 each). Alternatively, you can sign up for Bumble Boost or Bumble Premium; both offer 5 free SuperSwipes per week. [4] X Research source Bumble Boost can be purchased for 1 week ($20), 1 month ($40), 3 months ($60) or 6 months ($100). Bumble Premium can be purchased for 1 week ($30), 1 month ($60) or 3 months ($119). It can also be purchased as a lifetime service (not a subscription) for $300.

steps.title: You haven't reached their profile yet.
steps.content: You haven't reached their profile yet. Even though someone SuperSwiped you, they won't necessarily be the first person in your match queue. Keep swiping through the stack until you see a yellow star icon and "SuperSwiped You!" on their profile.

steps.title: They don't meet your filter requirements.
steps.content: They don't meet your filter requirements. If you received a notification that someone SuperSwiped you but still haven't found their profile in your stack, your filters may be too restrictive. Try expanding your distance, age, height, or other filters, even if only temporarily, to find your SuperSwiper. [5] X Research source If you expand your filter preferences sometime in the future to include someone who once SuperSwiped you a while ago, they'll eventually show up in your match queue no matter how long ago they SuperSwiped.

steps.title: They left Bumble.
steps.content: They left Bumble. If the person who SuperSwiped you deactivates their profile before you get a chance to see it, they'll never appear in your match stack unless they reactivate in the future.

steps.title: SuperSwiped profiles won't show up again unless the person likes you.
steps.content: SuperSwiped profiles won't show up again unless the person likes you. It's just like swiping right on someone's profile—once you SuperSwipe someone, you'll move on to the next person in your match queue. However, if the person you SuperSwiped swipes right on your profile, you'll have a match, which means you'll be able to see their profile again.

steps.title: There's no way to undo a SuperSwipe or accidental right swipe.
steps.content: There's no way to undo a SuperSwipe or accidental right swipe. Unfortunately, it's very easy to accidentally SuperSwipe someone, as the SuperSwipe yellow star icon is prominent at the bottom-right corner of each profile. If you've accidentally SuperSwiped someone and they match you, the best thing you can do is (kindly) let the person know that it was an accident. Bumble Premium and Bumble Boost's Backtrack feature, which allows you to undo accidental left swipes, don't work for accidental right swipes or SuperSwipes. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Upload fun and intriguing photos of yourself.
steps.content: Upload fun and intriguing photos of yourself. You can upload up to 6 photos to your profile, so take advantage and use every slot. According to dating coach Lauren Sanders, the more photos, the better! It’s the best way to get a match on Bumble. Choose photos you feel good about, and ideally, some that feature you doing a cool activity or having fun (along with some selfies or portraits). [7] X Research source Taking a photo of your left side may be surprisingly effective. When it comes to portraits, people tend to like the left side better. Try not to post photos with other people in them. Potential matches should be focused on you and you alone!

steps.title: Write a catchy bio.
steps.content: Write a catchy bio. Bumble bios can be 300 characters long, so make the most of that space. Sanders also recommends that your profile bio be as detailed as possible. Be genuine, focusing on who you are and your interests. If you can’t decide what to write, think about the type of person you want to attract and the values that matter most to you—and write your Bumble bio with those ideas in mind. For example, if you love to laugh and want to meet someone with a great sense of humor, include a witty joke in your bio. If you want to date someone as compassionate and altruistic as you, write a little about your past volunteer work.

steps.title: Fill out some of Bumble’s profile prompts.
steps.content: Fill out some of Bumble’s profile prompts. Bumble offers prompts to help you add personality to your profile, and you can post up to 3. So, add thoughtful responses that reveal more about who you are and what you want out of a relationship. Sanders recommends being very thorough when explaining your relationship desires and goals to help you stand out and find the best match possible. Give potential matches a glimpse of your life; your prompt responses could even be conversation starters later on! [8] X Research source

steps.title: Add the maximum number of badges to your profile.
steps.content: Add the maximum number of badges to your profile. Bumble allows you to add up to 10 Basic Info badges to your profile, including details like your location, height, political affiliations, what kind of relationship you want, your interests, and so on. Badges can help potential matches quickly see what they have in common with you (or what they don’t), so be sure to use them.
